entry.title: CTV + CSFS: a letter
entry.summary: In an insightful exchange on Bitcoin development, Matt Corallo expressed a preference for CTV (CheckTemplateVerify) over TXHASH. This perspective is supported by insights from the author of TXHASH, shared on Delving Bitcoin, a platform dedicated to in-depth discussions on Bitcoin technology. The author acknowledges that while TXHASH presents its own set of advantages, the complexity it introduces might not be justifiable without clear and enumerated use-cases. Conversely, CTV is highlighted for its ability to be upgraded and modified, which could accommodate future uses as they become better understood. This conversation underscores a critical aspect of blockchain development: the need for scalability and adaptability in protocols. The dialogue took place in the context of the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, indicating the ongoing conversations among developers about the direction of Bitcoin's technological advancements. For further details, the original discussion can be accessed at [Delving Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/ctv-csfs-can-we-reach-consensus-on-a-first-step-towards-covenants/1509/15).
